revised_title: The Chromosome Mechanics in Salivary Gland Nuclei of Drosophila
tldr: The author examines the structure and mechanics of chromosomes in salivary gland nuclei of Drosophila, discovering that these chromosomes are made up of multiple threads with banded structures representing genes. The author also observes the pairing and coiling of chromosomes, which helps in understanding their genetic relationships and potential for gene mapping.
